x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact: Build a multilingual dictionary that translates SDG-related terms into indigenous and local languages. Each term includes a simple explanation and local proverbs or phrases that convey the same concept, making global ideas understandable through cultural context.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: The United Nations publishes Sustainable Development Goals in six official languages (English, French, Spanish, Russian, Chinese, Arabic), but there are over 7,000 languages spoken worldwide. Millions of people—particularly in rural Africa, Asia, and indigenous communities—cannot access SDG information in their native languages. This creates a barrier to civic participation, education, and community organizing. Local leaders, teachers, radio hosts, and grassroots activists struggle to explain global development concepts to their communities because the vocabulary simply doesn't exist in accessible formats.
